main event: An unidentified flying object was observed near Salisbury, Maryland on August 23, 1952.
interesting points: The object was described as a bright light, about as large as a pin head, which moved slowly at an altitude of 500 to 1,000 feet.
The object was observed for approximately 1 minute before disappearing.
The report mentions that the object was observed visually from the ground and was described as silvery in color, circular in shape, and flying at a high rate of speed.
The witness was reportedly a lawyer from Salisbury, Maryland who observed the object for approximately 1 to 3 seconds.
The weather conditions at the time included an overcast sky, fog, and haze, with winds at various altitudes.
sighted object: a bright light, silvery circular object
witnesses: a resident of Salisbury, Maryland (reported as a lawyer)
